member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsConverter
member.summary: The serialization converter allows for customization of the serialization process.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConverter.Serializer
member.summary: The serializer that was owns this converter.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.CanProcess(System.Type)
member.summary: Can this converter serialize and deserialize the given object type?
member.param: The given object type.
member.returns: True if the converter can serialize it, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.RequestCycleSupport(System.Type)
member.summary: If true, then the serializer will support cyclic references with the given converted type.
member.param: The field/property type that is currently storing the object that is being serialized.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.RequestInheritanceSupport(System.Type)
member.summary: If true, then the serializer will include inheritance data for the given converter.
member.param: The field/property type that is currently storing the object that is being serialized.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.TrySerialize(System.Object,FullSerializer.fsData@,System.Type)
member.summary: Serialize the actual object into the given data storage.
member.param: The object instance to serialize. This will never be null.
The serialized state.
The field/property type that is storing this instance.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.TryDeserialize(FullSerializer.fsData,System.Object@,System.Type)
member.summary: Deserialize data into the object instance.
member.param: Serialization data to deserialize from.
The object instance to deserialize into.
The field/property type that is storing the instance.
member.returns: True if serialization was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsConverter.CreateInstance(FullSerializer.fsData,System.Type)
member.summary: Construct an object instance that will be passed to TryDeserialize. This should **not** deserialize the object.
member.param: The data the object was serialized with.
The field/property type that is storing the instance.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsDateConverter
member.summary: Supports serialization for DateTime, DateTimeOffset, and TimeSpan.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsEnumConverter
member.summary: Serializes and deserializes enums by their current name.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsEnumConverter.ArrayContains``1(``0[],``0)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is contained within the specified array.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsGuidConverter
member.summary: Serializes and deserializes guids.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsNullableConverter
member.summary: The reflected converter will properly serialize nullable types. However, we do it here instead as we can emit less serialization data.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsConfig
member.summary: A serialization configuration class to chose custom attributes for [de]serialization

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConfig.SerializeAttributes
member.summary: The attributes to use to serialize members

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConfig.DontSerializeAttributes
member.summary: The attributes to use to ignore serialization on members

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConfig.StrictMode
member.summary: If true, we'd return from deserialization of IEnumerable objects if there was a failure, otherwise we move on, ignoring the element that failed to deserialize

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConfig.Log
member.summary: Used by the serializer to log certain events

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsConfig.ShouldLog
member.summary: Is logging turned on?

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsContext
member.summary: fsContext stores global metadata that can be used to customize how fsConverters operate during serialization.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsContext._contextObjects
member.summary: All of the context objects.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsContext.Reset
member.summary: Removes all context objects from the context.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsContext.Set``1(``0)
member.summary: Sets the context object for the given type with the given value.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsContext.Has``1
member.summary: Returns true if there is a context object for the given type.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsContext.Get``1
member.summary: Fetches the context object for the given type.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsDataType
member.summary: The actual type that a JsonData instance can store.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsData
member.summary: A union type that stores a serialized value. The stored type can be one of six different types: null, boolean, float, string, Dictionary, or List.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsData.value
member.summary: The raw value that this serialized data stores. It can be one of six different types; a boolean, a float, a string, a Dictionary, or a List.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds null.

member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds a boolean.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds a float.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds a string.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,FullSerializer.fsData})
member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds a dictionary of values.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{FullSerializer.fsData})
member.summary: Creates a SerializedData instance that holds a list of values.

member.summary: Helper method to create a SerializedData instance that holds a dictionary.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.CreateList
member.summary: Helper method to create a SerializedData instance that holds a list.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.Cast``1
member.summary: Internal helper method to cast the underlying storage to the given type or throw a pretty printed exception on failure.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.op_Equality(FullSerializer.fsData,FullSerializer.fsData)
member.summary: Returns true iff a == b.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.op_Inequality(FullSerializer.fsData,FullSerializer.fsData)
member.summary: Returns true iff a != b.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsData.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsData.AsFloat
member.summary: Casts this SerializedData to a float. Throws an exception if it is not a float.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsData.AsBool
member.summary: Casts this SerializedData to a boolean. Throws an exception if it is not a boolean.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsData.AsString
member.summary: Casts this SerializedData to a string. Throws an exception if it is not a string.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsData.AsDictionary
member.summary: Casts this SerializedData to a Dictionary. Throws an exception if it is not a Dictionary.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsData.AsList
member.summary: Casts this SerializedData to a List. Throws an exception if it is not a List.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: The given property or field annotated with [JsonIgnore] will not be serialized.

member.summary: A simple recursive descent parser for JSON.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsJsonParser.SkipSpace
member.summary: Skips input such that Character() will return a non-whitespace character

member.summary: Parses numbers that follow the regular expression [-+](\d+|\d*\.\d*)

member.summary: Parses a string

member.summary: Parses an array

member.summary: Parses the specified input. Throws a ParseException if parsing failed.
member.param: The input to parse.

member.summary: Inserts the given number of indents into the builder.

member.summary: Escapes a string.

member.summary: Formats this data into the given builder.

member.summary: Writes the pretty JSON output data to the given stream.
member.param: The data to print.
Where to write the printed data.

member.summary: Returns the data in a pretty printed JSON format.

member.summary: Writes the compressed JSON output data to the given stream.
member.param: The data to print.
Where to write the printed data.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsJsonPrinter.CompressedJson(FullSerializer.fsData)
member.summary: Returns the data in a relatively compressed JSON format.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization
member.summary: Controls how the reflected converter handles member serialization.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization.OptIn
member.summary: Only members with [SerializeField] or [fsProperty] attributes are serialized.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization.Default
member.summary: The default member serialization behavior is applied.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute
member.summary: This attribute controls some serialization behavior for a type. See the comments on each of the fields for more information.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.PreviousModels
member.summary: The previous model that should be used if an old version of this object is encountered. Using this attribute also requires that the type have a public constructor that takes only one parameter, an object instance of the given type. Use of this parameter *requires* that the VersionString parameter is also set.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.VersionString
member.summary: The version string to use for this model. This should be unique among all prior versions of this model that is supported for importation. If PreviousModel is set, then this attribute must also be set. A good valid example for this is "v1", "v2", "v3", ...

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.MemberSerialization
member.summary: This controls the behavior for member serialization. The default behavior is fsMemberSerialization.Default.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsPropertyAttribute
member.summary: Explicitly mark a property to be serialized. This can also be used to give the name that the property should use during serialization.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsPropertyAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of that the property will use in JSON serialization.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_ObjectReference
member.summary: This is an object reference in part of a cyclic graph.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_ObjectDefinition
member.summary: This is an object definition, as part of a cyclic graph.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_InstanceType
member.summary: This specifies the actual type of an object (the instance type was different from the field type).

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_Version
member.summary: The version string for the serialized data.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_Content
member.summary: If we have to add metadata but the original serialized state was not a dictionary, then this will contain the original data.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.ConvertLegacyData(FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: This function converts legacy serialization data into the new format, so that the import process can be unified and ignore the old format.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.EnsureDictionary(FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Ensures that the data is a dictionary. If it is not, then it is wrapped inside of one.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.cachedConverters
member.summary: A cache from type to it's converter.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.converters
member.summary: Converters that are available.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.references
member.summary: Reference manager for cycle detection.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Context
member.summary: A context object that fsConverters can use to customize how they operate.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.AddConverter(FullSerializer.fsConverter)
member.summary: Adds a new converter that can be used to customize how an object is serialized and deserialized.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.GetConverter(System.Type)
member.summary: Fetches a converter that can serialize/deserialize the given type.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TrySerialize``1(``0,FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Helper method that simply forwards the call to TrySerialize(typeof(T), instance, out data);

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TryDeserialize``1(FullSerializer.fsData,``0@)
member.summary: Generic wrapper around TryDeserialize that simply forwards the call.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TrySerialize(System.Type,System.Object,FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Serialize the given value.
member.param: The type of field/property that stores the object instance. This is important particularly for inheritance, as a field storing an IInterface instance should have type information included.
The actual object instance to serialize.
The serialized state of the object.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TryDeserialize(FullSerializer.fsData,System.Type,System.Object@)
member.summary: Attempts to deserialize a value from a serialized state.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Config
member.summary: Configuration object to use for custom serialization attributes

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsSerializer.fsLazyCycleDefinitionWriter
member.summary: This manages instance writing so that we do not write unnecessary $id fields. We only need to write out an $id field when there is a corresponding $ref field.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsOption`1
member.summary: Simple option type. This is akin to nullable types.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsPortableReflection
member.summary: This wraps reflection types so that it is portable across different Unity runtimes.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType.Ancestors
member.summary: The direct ancestors that this type can import.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType.VersionString
member.summary: The identifying string that is unique among all ancestors.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType.ModelType
member.summary: The modeling type that this versioned type maps back to.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType.Migrate(System.Object)
member.summary: Migrate from an instance of an ancestor.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionManager.VerifyConstructors(FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType)
member.summary: Verifies that the given type has constructors to migrate from all ancestor types.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionManager.VerifyUniqueVersionStrings(FullSerializer.Internal.fsVersionedType)
member.summary: Verifies that the given version graph contains only unique versions.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty
member.summary: A property or field on a MetaType.

member.name: F:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty._memberInfo
member.summary: Internal handle to the reflected member.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.Write(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes a value to the property that this MetaProperty represents, using given object instance as the context.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.Read(System.Object)
member.summary: Reads a value from the property that this MetaProperty represents, using the given object instance as the context.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.GetName(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Returns the name the given member wants to use for JSON serialization.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.StorageType
member.summary: The type of value that is stored inside of the property. For example, for an int field, StorageType will be typeof(int).

member.name: P:FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.Name
member.summary: The serialized name of the property, as it should appear in JSON.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.fsMetaType
member.summary: MetaType contains metadata about a type. This is used by the reflection serializer.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsMetaType.SetProperties(System.String[])
member.summary: Override the default property names and use the given ones instead of serialization.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.fsMetaType.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type that this metadata points back to. If this type has a default constructor, then Activator.CreateInstance will be used to construct the type (or Array.CreateInstance if it an array). Otherwise, an uninitialized object created via FormatterServices.GetSafeUninitializedObject is used to construct the instance.

member.name: P:FullSerializer.fsMetaType.HasDefaultConstructor
member.summary: Returns true if the type represented by this metadata contains a default constructor.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsReflectionUtility.GetInterface(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Searches for a particular implementation of the given interface type inside of the type. This is particularly useful if the interface type is an open type, ie, typeof(IFace{}), because this method will then return IFace{} but with appropriate type parameters inserted.
member.param: The base type to search for interface
The interface type to search for. Can be an open generic type.
member.returns: The actual interface type that the type contains, or null if there is no implementation of the given interfaceType on type.

member.name: T:FullSerializer.Internal.fsTypeLookup
member.summary: Provides APIs for looking up types based on their name.

member.name: M:FullSerializer.Internal.fsTypeLookup.GetType(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to lookup the given type. Returns null if the type lookup fails.
